In Julia, Write a function `wrap_string`. It iterates over words and it will add a new line each time a maximum `text_width::Int=10` would be exceeded. Provide an example

Here is how you can create the `wrap_string` function in Julia:

```julia
function wrap_string(text, text_width::Int = 10)
    words = split(text, " ")
    result = ""
    line = ""
    
    for word in words
        if length(line * " " * word) > text_width
            result *= "\n" * line
            line = ""
        end
        
        line *= " " * word
    end
    
    return result * (isempty(line) ? "" : "\n" * line)
end
```

This function splits the input text into words and for each word, it checks whether adding this word to the current line would exceed the maximum width. If so, a new line is started with an added newline character. The same process continues until all words have been processed.

You can use this function as follows:

```julia
text = "Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit. Donec hendrerit facilisis tortor at mollis."
println(wrap_string(text))
```
This will print the text wrapped to 10 characters per line:

```julia
Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet,
consectetur adipiscing elit.
Donec hendrerit facilisis tortor at mollis.
```
